intro: Odontites ruber var. vernus, commonly known as the early red violets, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant produces violet-colored blooms that typically appear in early spring, hence its common name. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and meadows.
